page.title: 14BUILDINGS
page.content: The type of housing you will find in Clyst Hydon is varied. There is cob and thatch (cob) .It is a mixture of mud and straw (dung). To make this you mix it up and down to make a wall. You then let it dry and you get a hard strong substance called cob.There are brick buildings. Most of them are rendered.There is a Close and a Manor and we found out about it alot.The Manor House was built in 1830 by the Rev. John Huyshe.It was built as a parsonage because the old one was burnt down in 1812.The buildings around the yard. Some of them we think are older than these.We also think the oldest building is the barn.It was a barn but it was converted into a stable.There were four boxes.These housed four horses.There is a tack room and a coach house which is now used as a garage.
